attributes.action: A full police investigation into the owner of Steve Dale of Bury FC
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/football/2019/aug/23/bury-company-debt-cva-steve-dale-daughter

43 of 51 of Mr Dales previous companies have gone into liquidation.
attributes.background:
Bury FC limited was owned by Stewart Day  who ran up huge debts, then selling the company for £1 to Steve Dale. 

Steve Dale son in law then bought the debt for voting rights an agreed IVA.

Over £1m in income in 2019 and no staff or creditors paid. 

Independent enquiry needed into ownership

rejection.details:
An investigation would be the responsibility of the police. You could start a new petition calling for a clear action that is the responsibility of the Government or Parliament. For example, a petition calling for a public inquiry.

There are petitions about the broader issue which you might like to sign. You're more likely to get action on this issue if you sign and share a single petition.
